page.title: 16Cattle Market in Banbury (3)
page.content:
Banbury Stockyard is the largest in the United Kingdom. It was founded in 1924. The main selling days are Wednesdays and Thursdays. On Wednesdays they sell for breeding. Thursdays are for slaughter. In 1984 they sold: Slaughter Stock: Store Stock: Steers & Heifers 59,000 Cattle 78,000 Cows and Bulls 22,000 Sheep 66,000 Sheep,lambs, ewes and rams 270,000 Dairy Pigs,sows Products6,000 and boars 124,000
The perimeter of Banbury Stockyard is 1,165 metres. The number of pens is 2,924. The number of auction rings is six. The annual turnover is 86 million pounds sterling.
